newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Strong NZ dollar inevitable, says Bolger.
newsitem.headline: Strong NZ dollar inevitable, says Bolger.

text.p: Prime Minister Jim Bolger said on Thursday that confidence in the New Zealand economy meant a strong New Zealand dollar was inevitable.

Bolger said New Zealand was attempting to secure greater international competitiveness "while acknowledging that confidence in New Zealand's government and its economy will inevitably ensure a strong New Zealand dollar".
He was speaking at the 1997 Government to Business Summit in Wellington.
Bolger said the government's budget due in June would be consistent with the National and New Zealand First parties' coalition agreement.
"It will be a budget that emphasises health and education.
"These are two core areas that we seek to advance as we look to the decades ahead and seek to ensure that the right structures and systems are in place."
Bolger said change to the government's pension scheme would come whatever the outcome to a referendum in September on compulsory superannuation.
"Whatever is decided -- a savings-based scheme or a tax-based scheme -- they are both compulsory and the status quo is not sustainable on present tax levels for very long.
